alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:19AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hartford, Hampshire, northwestern Franklin and western Hampden Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 619 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartland, or 11 miles southwest of Westfield, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of heavy rainfall are forecast to continue this morning and afternoon. If prolonged heavy rainfall rates continue to occur over this area, a flash flood warning may be issued. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Chicopee, Westfield, Holyoke, Northampton, Agawam, West Springfield, Greenfield, Deerfield, South Hadley, Easthampton, Longmeadow, Suffield, Monroe, Granby, Southwick, Montague, Southampton, Hadley and East Granby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
